text: Hi Micela, I'm so sorry I'm only getting to you now!
Casual dress is definitely ok - jeans and a t-shirt or top are fine (or jumper)
A render wrangler is a good entry level position, and you will be exposed to a lot

I have never worked at Framestore, but getting in the door of any of the big London houses is a great way to start off. I'd assume Framestore have a training program that you'd be on alongside this, with clear direction

I would say be ready for questions like - what area of VFX are you interested in - and then when you tell them about what you're doing to build those skills thats really good. Showing an understanding of pipelines is good
And let them know you're interested in technical areas.

Its good to mention this too - that you've signed up for an industry mentor etc - they'll see that as very positive (feel free to mention me, I'm not sure if your interviewer will know me as I don't know who it will be, but its always good to have a sponsor in the industry!)

Hi Elaine! No worries at all! I hope you are doing great.

Thank you so much for the advise :) I hope everything goes well tomorrow. I will definitely follow it. 
Bournemouth was great! I loved the place and the campus, and the program sounds amazing as well. It is quite funny because I have everything ready to apply, but I thought I might give it a try applying for jobs at the same time as the masters, thinking I might not get any answer. So I was very surprised! and obviously happy. Anyway I will apply for the masters just in case as to have an option B :)
Wonderful!!! Best of luck tomorrow - I’m sure you’ll do great. Just bring your enthusiasm and have faith in yourself. Let me know how you get on! :-)
